page.title: 10NETHER ALDERLEY SCHOOL
page.content: In 1628 the original school was built by the church for boys.Then in 1822 Lady Stanly built this school for girls and infants.In 1867 the boys joined the girls and infants.In 1907 there were 57 pupils.Then Warford school closed and the pupils increased to 100.In 1907 the children were sent from Warford by horse and cart to Nether Alderley.In some rooms today you can still see the hooks for the oil lamps.The kitchen was the first to be built in Chesire because Lady Stanley didn't like to see the children going home for lunch.Lady Stanley built a special wooden cupboard with a glass front which kept socks ad shoes incase the children came with wet feet.Now the school is a County Primary School.It has 65 children and 4 teachers.It has 4 rooms
